Fog of War on the Minimap
Cloak Reveal Visualization
The Quartermaster
The Old South Distillery
Bellafide's insurrection was hatched at the Old South Distillery, where Longcoat partisans down their orn and toast the revolution to come.
The Skirts
Far beneath the unyielding desert sun, the vagrant Commonfolk scrape out a living in the ruins of an underground train station.
The Kitchens
Looming high above the Hagro Highlands, the heavily-fortified bunker known as The Kitchens is the iron heart of the bureaucratic institution known as the KSR.
The Great Feast
Sage Marro blinks and rolls his eyes, deciding the fates of two standing before him. Those sent to the Tree shall feast. Those sent to the Sun shall become the feast.
The Bonepit Riots
Bellafide reminisces about the insurrection in the Bonepits. Amidst the chaos, seek out the Civilized gristmill and demolish it!
Use the RALLY ARMY button near yellow enemies and your troops will fight them!
Black Sledge Uprising
In the hardest of times, loyalty isn't earned; it's bought. Under the KSR's nose, Bellafide gathers his army of paid insurgents.
Select FERRETS and use the RALLY GROUP button to blast turrets from a distance. To counter falcons, select SQUIRRELS and use RALLY GROUP to pick them out of the air!
46 South Dockside
Bellafide's riots will never spark into revolution without food. Your gristmills in South Dockside are converting grain into meat for the cause. You must defend them!
Build FARMS around your gristmills to make food. Remember to build TURRETS before the enemy launches their attack!
Fuel of the Firebrand
The harvest is healthy and the Longcoats are now poised to purge the Civilized from the city. Recruit Butter's brother and burn the Civilized army to ash!
Build FARMS to make more food, then spend food on bullet hives and new warrens in addition to hiring the recruits near your mill!
Hollow in The Gut
Mutiny! Traitorous squirrels from the Distillery have stolen meat from a Longcoat settlement called the Gut. Bellafide must sell some of his weaponry to stave off starvation.
Sell TURRETS and build FARMS to escape starvation, then build an army of SQUIRRELS to defend yourself! Build MOLES to take out enemy structures!
To the Ends
With his army in shambles, Bellafide flees to the desert in a desperate attempt to forge an alliance with the Commonfolk. Find Hopper, then eliminate Archimedes and his Civilized army!
Seek out Hopper and recruit her Commonfolk army to your cause!
Snikaree Liberation
The KSR labor camp in the Snikaree Foothills holds thousands of first-time offenders, kept well-fed with the remains of second-time offenders. Gather your army and free these doomed prisoners!
Use LIZARDS to attack the patrolling falcons, and use CHAMELEONS to free the prisoners. Heal your units in WATER. If you get lost, peek at your minimap!
The Siege of Ragfall Road

Bellafide's grand march into the city has led him right into a trap! The KSR and Civilized have joined forces, planning to rout him on Ragfall Road. If Arroyo is to survive, the Commonfolk must come to his aid!
Destroy the enemy warrens before they have a chance to spawn units.
The Sand Kiln at Levacaloo

The Nomads of the Levacaloo Desert are being converted to the Civilized cause by Archimedes and his honeyed words. As their food spoils in the searing heat, Hopper's Commonfolk mob marches across the sands to put them down.
Spend your food before it reaches 200 and spoils in the heat. The searing sands will burn enemy forces just as much as your own.
Scrapetown Cutpurse

The Longcoats of Scrapetown have yet to pledge loyalty to Bellafide's revolution, so Hopper has little compunction in pilfering their wares to take down the local KSR. Steal what you can, and bring victory to the Commonfolk!
Watch your minimap for meat pickups spawning near the Longcoat merchants. Find the prisons and free the prisoners!
Scrapetown Racket

At noon, the Civilized strode into Scrapetown. They turned up their noses at the aging goods proffered and look to a new source of meat: the merchants themselves! Protect the Longcoats and they will make it worth your while.
Build FOXES and TURRETS before any airborne enemies arrive.
The Hungry Face a Stiff Wind

High atop the Hagro Highlands, the KSR have long doled out meager rations to keep the Commonfolk under their claw. But as the Kitchens are gripped by the worst winter storm in harvests, Hopper marches against the Quartermaster, and into history.
Keep an eye on the TIMER and bring your RANGED UNITS back to defend against incoming waves of Wing Demons.
Frozen in Noe

The Tsarina has been murdered! The populace is in chaos! Only the KSR can restore peace and order. Clear out the lawless forests of the Noe District, ridding them of the Commonfolk skulking therein. Light the campfires and reassert KSR authority!
Build BARBED WIRE to slow down incoming enemies and force them to freeze.
Howling Vell

Faced with the formidable Longcoat army on the shores of Lake Vell, the KSR decides to unleash its new tunneling technology, allowing their forces to emerge from warrens directly onto the battlefield. Take charge and crush Bellafide's army.
Use the WOLF to speed up your farmers, but be careful, your farms will go fallow twice as quickly!
Defense of the Cold Mark Lows

Until now, the KSR has fought to maintain order, never taking sides in the conflict erupting around them. Yet when the Civilized send a messenger pleading for aid in their battle against Hopper and Bellafide, the Quartermaster is finally spurred into action.
Use DEFENSES to contain enemies within their bases, then use WOLVES and PIGEONS to support Archimedes as he attacks.
Betrayal at Vacancee

The sounds of gunfire rumble through early morning fog shrouding the high security prison in Vacancee Flats. The Civilized have turned on the KSR, breaking free the state's most violent and dangerous criminals to aid in their ongoing battle against the Longcoats. Stop them from freeing the prisoners!
SELL OFF DEFENSES in useless positions to strengthen your economy and BUILD AN ARMY as quickly as possible!
The War For Meat
As dawn creeps over South Noe Meadows, the standoff between the four armies has finally broken. The snow shall melt 'neath fallen flesh this day, and the KSR shall climb to victory atop them.
Enemies will primarily target you, but they will fight each other if you can put another faction's base between them and you.
What Might Be

The petty conflicts of the Commonfolk, Longcoats, and Civilized have brought naught but chaos and uncertainty. You will bring order back to this world gone mad, purging it with a spring hail courtesy of the KSR's latest weapons technology. Your enemies will cower before the might of the KSR by this day's end!
Slowly build DEFENSES around well-protected campfires. Use MILITARIZED SUGAR to travel quickly across the map and take out invaders!
Bonepit Exile

When Bellafide's revolution began, the Civilized knew exile was inevitable. As an army of Longcoats swept through the Bonepits, Archimedes turned his efforts to securing their food supplies; only with them would the Civilized survive their banishment in the harsh deserts.
SELL OFF useless turrets and build warrens with the food. Receiving food for killed units means you will likely have a huge bank to build an army!
Awash in Solawa

A haboob struck the canyon known as Solawa, where the Civilized walked among a hostile people. Best the storm and convert the desert people to your cause, sustaining them on the flesh of the unwilling!
HEAL your injured troops in the WATER. Build LANDMINES when your food starts to spoil.
Vacancee Downfall

Bellafide's Longcoat army grows stronger with each passing day, yet the KSR continually refuses to deal with them. The Quartermaster has long been an ally to the Civilized, but the time has come to hold her inaction to account. Strike her down in the Vacancee Highlands!
You can use BADGERS to free prisoners without taking any losses. BALLOONS will help to defend against boars and foxes.
Sage Marro Speaks

The three armies speak of peace, of building a new society in Snikaree. But history is a circle: such accords, no matter how propitious, are doomed to fail, and chaos shall follow in their wake. The Sage Marro has spoken: you must slaughter them all.
Make sure you defend your warrens at night or the Commonfolk will invade and destroy your production!
Swine, Inscribed

The Monastic Gardens have long been the home of the Swine, faithful servants of the Civilized world order. Yet your enemies have discovered their location, and it is only a matter of time before they descend upon it. Protect the Gardens and repay the Swine for their unfailing dedication!
The farmers can be contained with careful use of BARBED WIRE.
Victors Will Feast

Many seasons have passed. Alliances have been forged and broken in turn, loyalty repaid with naught but treachery. The Swine have arranged one final battle amongst the battered and broken armies to decide the fate of beasts. Blood will mix in the snow falling over Noe District, and the victor shall feast eternal.
You made it this far, no hints for you!
Nomads of the North
Immigrants from the tribal north wear furs to keep their cold blood running hot.
Swift, Spear Throw
Engineers for Hire
Despite their name, the Engineers appear to be far better at knocking things over rather than building them up.
Proxy, Structure Crit
The Volunteers
At the onset of war, soldiers were too proud to consume the little white packets that fell from the skies. Now they'll take anything they can get.
Flying, Medic
The Distillery Brothers
Conscripted into service and certain of their doom, the untrained Distillery Brothers charge into battle fueled by fermented acorn courage.
Morning Light Croakers
True believers, the Morning Light Croakers often appear to regret their religious devotion just before fuse hits powder.
The Trench Gang
Nobody crosses the Trench Gang. Nobody. Well, some have crossed the Trench Gang. But only once. Don't cross the Trench Gang.
Stealth, Melee
Wing Demons
An all-male detachment of aerial combat specialists, the cocky Wing Demons compete for kills, food, and female companionship.
Flying, SMG
The Freight Union
Customers beware: While the Freight Union guarantees speedy delivery, their contract provides no warranty on the state of goods upon shipment.
The Glorious AFB
Previously unwelcome in high society, the Glorious AFB's silent tactics were so deadly that they became awkward national heroes.
Toxic Grenades
Tooth Collectors
When debts are not paid, the Tooth Collectors arrive. When no teeth remain, venom is the only way.
Projectile Poison
Inmate #43B
Her entire family was locked up under the pretense of criminal insanity. While in prison, said affliction became a reality.
Minigun, Agile
Uncle Butter
Before the war, he was known as the country's greatest gourmand. Uncle Butter still cooks his meat, but he no longer kills his prey first.
Flamethrower, AOE
Kasha, Farmhand
She spent her summers sitting on the roof, picking off rustlers and interlopers. She hates the city, and is happy to be back at home in the countryside.
Swift, Sniper
The Matriark
The Family does not suffer disloyalty: Traitors are eaten. But the Matriark is not without pity. The repentant are regurgitated for one last chance to serve.
Flying, Spawner
Drill Sergeant Volkov
A shy bureaucrat before the war, Drill Sergeant Volkov uncovered a side to his personality that no one knew was there: He now inspires unmitigated devotion and fear.
Speed Buff
Drumfire Cannon
After the Operators were forced to close the artillery shell factories, they resorted to loading Drumfire cannons with the bones of their enemies.
Thermal Airsniper
There's an old saying among Balloon Operators: "Stay alert, stay on target, and never, ever, look down."
Flying, Sniper
Barbed Wire
Feather Wire
Legend has it that the first shipment of barbed wire was mislabeled, "Feathers" by an overworked Operator. The name stuck ever since.
Anti-Range, Slow
The portraits on top of tremormines memorialize fallen Operators. No Operator goes down without a fight, and none rests without revenge.
Explosive, Stealth, Summon
Bullet Hive
Future generations will find great riches in the battlefields where bullet casings from the Bullet Hives stacked many heads deep.
Machine Gun
Militarized Sugar
Militarized Sugar
Shooga was traditionally used by Northern tribesmen as both a sweetener and a firecracker. Once militarized, the compound became much more dangerous.
Training Dummy

I told my son...
We won't work the farms, no.
We won't eat the food of beasts.
We'll eat MEAT, as any civilized animal does.
But when the Civilized called a Harvest...
And the city FEASTED on my boy...
We took to the warrens and lit the country AFLAME!
Who decides the fate of animals?
The Longcoats?
The Commonfolk?
The KSR?
Or the Civilized?
Whoever triumphs will go hungry no more...
Those who fall will be DINNER!
Bullet Hives
Maintenance Tunnel
In order to guarantee meat and building materials remain untouched by greedy hands and harsh weather, it is best to transport and store them underground.
Summon, Territory, Repairs
Hey, furball. You need me to send a message to the Longcoats?
Who goes there?
~IT IS I, HOPPER, COME TO FREE THE-
Ha! Shut yer muzzle, Hopper. Glad to see ya back in the Skirts. KSR give you any trouble?
~No mo' den any ol' day. How's food?
Not good. Never good. Runnin' low on meat, an' it's back to beast food after that.
~I'll see what I can do. Say hey to da Matriark fo' me!
Will do.
Haha he he. Hopper got one arm. Snip snip! Came right off! Tasty tasty!
Engineer sorry!
Hopper! Hopper, tell Trench Gang to leave engineer alone!
~Let 'im be, Fedge! An' mebbe lay off da orn a bit?
Heyyy, Hopper. Got any meat to spare?
~Poor Kasha's been workin' 'erself ragged helpin' us. Should leave 'er be.
Hopper, I never had a chance to thank you. For helping me, letting me stay here...
~Aaah, ain't no prob! Friends do nice 'tings fer one anotha'! So, you ready?
Ready? Ready for what?
~Ready fo' da powerful to fall. Mob's marchin' to Hagro. To da Larder.
The Larder? That's the Quartermaster's meat supply... You sure about this?
~Yeh. Time's come, Kasha. Afta' tonight, we gonna eat like da Tsarina, bless 'er.
~Talk to da Matriark. We gonna need da Trench Gang an' da Nomads too.
~KSR gonna be no mo'. Da masses about ta' get tyrannical.
Sister Nomads need help, Hopper. Matriark says you help.
